item.title: Kid gets slammed with desk
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“TabbyKiller, post:33, topic:494688”][quote author=Tutorial link=topic=612920.msg4240007#msg4240007 date=1361768283]

It’s just a lovein’ soda… That red kid needs a smack himself

Its the principal that matters, really.

Do you let people go around stealing shit from you?

In the end this is true. There have been times before where I wish at the moment I had less control over my actions and let myself loose. If I had found someone was stealing and rummaging through my bag, I would want to probably smash a chair into their face too, I just don’t have the lack of control to do it.

So you would risk giving someone internal brain injury over a soda?

I would if they stole something from me, especially if it was concealed in a private area. I’m pretty sure it was a last resort, and probably was discussed for a few minutes until the person finally had enough.
[/quote]
Do you realize what you are saying? You’re saying you would risk giving this guy a brain damage over a $1.50 can of soda, compared to $1.50 I wouldn’t want jail/juvy time nor having to be the one responsible for giving the kid brain injury or even death. I would understand a small shove over but smacking the kid over with a desk, around me I would fight for the kid in blue. Plus it’s not like the kid couldn’t have paid him off[/quote]
Why do you keep using a biased interpretation of the situation? The ideal of it remains the same, no matter what item was stolen or what the victim decided to do. Of course, I do believe that both people should be punished, but they should be punished based by the crime they committed. If you steal something from a store, whether it be cheap candy or a flat screen television, you can legally only be punished for theft.

Read full topic

what gave it away

He would have been better off just spitting in the guys face. Its all the same thing

Except spit doesn’t cause fucking brain damage. If someone disrespected me in real life why should I give a shit? They mean nothing to me, and I don’t need their respect.[/quote]

item.title: Kid gets slammed with desk
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

[quote=“hat trix, post:53, topic:494688”][quote author=TabbyKiller link=topic=612920.msg4241791#msg4241791 date=1361866260]

[quote]Wrong. It’s not just a soda. [size=1pt]It’s a pop.[/size] It’s a matter of disrespect and the blue kid thinking he can treat the red kid like that. The blue kid put him in his place. I’m siding with him.

He could have probably killed the kid because someone merely disrespected him (who is he to have earned any kind of respect anyways? If he’s someone that resorts to pummeling someone with a god damned desk he’s surely not someone who deserves any kind of respect to begin with).

merely disrespected? There is no “merely” disrespect. disrespect is disrespect. He would have been better off just spitting in the guys face. Its all the same thing
[/quote]
That made me chuckle. Losing a soda wouldn’t have lost the red guy respect, beating the blue kid up would have. Why? Because beating the shit out of some kid who stole a soda is obviously blowing out of proportion. This is all just some highschool teen immaturity, you’ll find once you grow up (i hope) beating the shit out of your co-worker will get you fired and put you into a position where you probably wont be able to support your family or maybe even yourself. The kid was lucky he wasn’t charged with anything because in the end a living life weighs down the scales a lot more than a can full of sugar. If you think what the red kid done was ethically right then sir, why are you considered humane.
[/quote]
I also never said what the kid did was right. But how does someone stealing from you not lose your respect for said person again?[/quote]
If anyone out of them both the person who would have lost respect would have been the thief. Thieves are not loved by anyone but then someone who beats the shit out of someone else is even more frowned upon

Read full topic

merely disrespected? There is no “merely” disrespect. disrespect is disrespect. He would have been better off just spitting in the guys face. Its all the same thing

That made me chuckle. Losing a soda wouldn’t have lost the red guy respect, beating the blue kid up would have. Why? Because beating the shit out of some kid who stole a soda is obviously blowing out of proportion. This is all just some highschool teen immaturity, you’ll find once you grow up (i hope) beating the shit out of your co-worker will get you fired and put you into a position where you probably wont be able to support your family or maybe even yourself. The kid was lucky he wasn’t charged with anything because in the end a living life weighs down the scales a lot more than a can full of sugar. If you think what the red kid done was ethically right then sir, why are you considered humane.[/quote]

item.title: Kid gets slammed with desk
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

[quote=“Elrick, post:39, topic:494688”][quote author=TabbyKiller link=topic=612920.msg4240026#msg4240026 date=1361768802]

It’s just a lovein’ soda… That red kid needs a smack himself

Its the principal that matters, really.

Do you let people go around stealing shit from you?

In the end this is true. There have been times before where I wish at the moment I had less control over my actions and let myself loose. If I had found someone was stealing and rummaging through my bag, I would want to probably smash a chair into their face too, I just don’t have the lack of control to do it.

So you would risk giving someone internal brain injury over a soda?

I would if they stole something from me, especially if it was concealed in a private area. I’m pretty sure it was a last resort, and probably was discussed for a few minutes until the person finally had enough.

Do you realize what you are saying? You’re saying you would risk giving this guy a brain damage over a $1.50 can of soda, compared to $1.50 I wouldn’t want jail/juvy time nor having to be the one responsible for giving the kid brain injury or even death. I would understand a small shove over but smacking the kid over with a desk, around me I would fight for the kid in blue. Plus it’s not like the kid couldn’t have paid him off
[/quote]
This is the same risk of ANY confrontation. I could just as easily throw a right hand hook and hit the side of their skull, force force my palm into their nose, or punch them in the back of the head. I could just throw him to the ground and have him hit his head on the ground. All of these situations of course would be not within the intention of killing a person. This is a theoretical discussion we are having, this includes assuming that in the end we are not going to kill said person.[/quote]
Yes but what he did was intentional and direct impact

Read full topic

half of you are retarded siding with the kid who bashed the other with a desk. are you fucking stupid? I could see someone getting punched because the other stole and laughed but a fking desk? “Bitch you stole my soda… now you must die” Yea that makes sense…

Sure it was fked up for him to steal and laugh but I dont think he deserved a desk to the side of the face over a damn soda. Him being tossed to the ground would have been enough.
